column4: RT @SenatorBraun: President ⁦⁦@realDonaldTrump finalized the Transparency in Coverage rule to make real-time accurate estimates for healthc…
RT @Avik: We should actually do *more* to help low-income Americans afford coverage. By all means, let's reduce health care subsidies: by e…

Did you know that in Arkansas alone, the forest industry employs more than 64,000 people? Well-managed forests supply many of the products we use every day, thanks to the private landowners and employees who work to keep forests healthy. #NationalForestProductsWeek

It's #nationalforestproductsweek! When COVID-19 hit and there was a run on toilet paper and paper towels, everyone saw how important these products are to our daily lives.

Thank you to the men and women who work to keep forest products on our shelves. We appreciate all you do. https://t.co/ocpyHZwXXt

After the infamous thumbs down vote on ACA repeal, I began working on a health care solution. It's one of the most contentious issues in politics, but it shouldn't be. Contrary to popular belief, the GOP has a plan: the bicameral, bipartisan Fair Care Act. https://t.co/BSSFwIal93
RT @SenatorBraun: Republicans have a health care plan: the Fair Care Act is over 500 pages of legislative text based on years of research t…

Democrat senators are using the #ConfirmationHearing to talk about the ACA, but this accepts a precedent of SCOTUS legislating from the bench. It must end. It’s not the Court’s duty to legislate health care, it’s Congress’s. Bills like the Fair Care Act are the solutions we need.

Think Republicans don’t have a health care plan? False! @SenatorBraun and I introduced the Fair Care Act of 2020, with dozens of bipartisan provisions. It gives more Americans coverage at lower costs, even people with preexisting conditions.

It’s the solution we need. #debates

It's been a busy week in D.C., and I'm looking forward to getting back to AR and seeing some of you on my annual agriculture tour. Before I left town, though, I wanted to take a minute to update you on what's been happening here with COVID-19 relief and other legislative issues. https://t.co/dpb4rdCq6n

My prayers are with President Trump and the First Lady, and I wish them a swift recovery. This is a sobering reminder of just how many Americans have been impacted by the virus, and I know the nation stands behind them and supports them.

We will defeat COVID-19.

I’m proud to be leading the congressional effort with my bill, the Trillion Trees Act. This should be the first of many steps toward a healthy and resilient environment.

I hope to see more of my colleagues on both sides of the aisle support this initiative. https://t.co/JgS5yZEGna

We DO have a health care plan: the Fair Care Act of 2020. It covers all patients with pre-existing conditions AND with lower premiums. Yes, it’s all possible!

Don’t believe the lie that the GOP would limit care. We want to make it more accessible for all. #PresidentialDebate2020

My bill, the Fair Care Act of 2020, covers preexisting conditions, increases coverage choices, lowers insurance and prescription drug costs and promotes telehealth.

These solutions will put the president's plan into congressional action as part of our #CommitmentToAmerica. https://t.co/sdVRAZ7dJa

It's #SmallBusinessWeek, the perfect time to shop local. COVID-19 has hit small businesses hard, and many are struggling to stay open.

Show your support for local businesses by following them on social media, telling others about your favorite stores, and shopping small! https://t.co/MCb3qDmIX7

It's #TruckDriverAppreciationWeek, and I want to thank all the men and women who kept America going during COVID-19. Without truck drivers constantly on the road delivering products across the country, our grocery store shelves would've been empty. Thank you for all you do! https://t.co/9PYWZNtehZ
RT @JohnBoozman: Today we remind those struggling with mental health challenges that they're not alone. There's always reason for hope. Sui…

Last week, I wrapped up my Everyday Heroes visits, thanking the many men and women who kept us going during COVID-19. 

I appreciate everyone who took time to meet with me over the past month - I know I speak for all Arkansans when I say "thank you" for your hard work! https://t.co/FQhPFgcCA3

The latest #JobsReport marks the fourth straight month of declining unemployment, signaling a steady economic recovery from COVID-19. 

We're not back to normal yet, but getting Americans back to work safely is a huge step in the right direction.

https://t.co/cjAoAgTRIB

I've gotten to continue my Everyday Heroes visits, thanking those who kept us going during COVID-19. 

CV's Family Foods, I-40 travel centers and Coleman Family Pharmacy are just a few of the businesses that keep serving their communities. I'm glad to say "thank you" in person! https://t.co/IWpHWkXXQT

To get our economy back up to speed, cheap, widespread COVID-19 testing is absolutely necessary. I recently sent a letter to @SteveFDA urging him to revise guidance for antigen tests. We already have this technology, so why isn't it more available?

More:
https://t.co/IHqjgvQ758

I joined @BloombergTV this morning to discuss the benefits of low-cost, rapid antigen testing. This must be the next phase in COVID-19 testing if we want to bring our schools and workplaces back up to speed. https://t.co/KDaetQvA40

The U.S. Post Office isn't going anywhere, and the bill we're voting on today has nothing to do with a fair election.

At a time when America has legitimate needs with a pandemic and a struggling economy, it’s no surprise that a manufactured crisis is the best Democrats can do. https://t.co/vdPuxqvK3E

The Texarkana Regional Airport has incredible staff who quickly adjusted to new safety protocol and kept necessary operations going during COVID-19. I'm so glad I got to stop by and thank the staff, as well as check out the progress on their new terminal. https://t.co/1IAhXBaB2p

Forestry is essential, providing everything from shipping boxes to paper towels. Even during COVID-19, we require guest workers to assist with planting and wildfire prevention, and @POTUS recently granted our request for an H-2B visa exemption.

More here: https://t.co/roOO0a68Vb

I continued my #EverydayHeroes visits today with stops at a @TysonFoods plant and the Ouachita Forest. Tyson has been instrumental in keeping our food supply chain up and running, and the U.S. Forest Service has continued managing our public land during the pandemic. Thank you! https://t.co/T5PNMboicl

Did your business receive a Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loan during COVID-19? If so, you may benefit from these updated loan forgiveness guidelines from the Small Business Administration.

https://t.co/cYSrP6OuuD

When I gave blood, I learned that I tested positive for COVID-19 antibodies, so I donated my plasma with hopes that someone else will benefit from it. 

If you’re willing and able to donate plasma, visit Arkansas Blood Institute’s website to learn more. https://t.co/q6GtF4EKhj

I got to kick off the #EverydayHeroes tour with Gary Troutman, Hot Springs Chamber of Commerce President and CEO. He shared some of the great things that several local businesses have accomplished during COVID-19, even when they had to switch their normal operations. https://t.co/vq5AjeCIjy

Finally, I wrapped up the day at Crystal Ridge Distillery. They immediately shifted gears a few months ago from producing moonshine to bottling hand sanitizer.

Thank you to these and so many other Arkansans who have kept our economy running during COVID-19! https://t.co/gcBGnKoJRg

Today I got to spend some time in Hot Springs, with the first stop at Tanner's Sports. They shifted their operations this spring into making face masks that meet CDC standards and are still breathable enough for athletes to wear. https://t.co/eQohd37dP3

During a normal August, I'm able to spend the month meeting with many of you at events around Arkansas. This year we're not able to do most of these meetings because of COVID-19, but I'll still be making stops to thank all our #EverydayHeroes who kept working during the pandemic.

In Arkansas' rural communities, telehealth services provide residents with fast, reliable medical care, which is why I've included a variety of telehealth provisions in the Fair Care Act. COVID-19 has made this even more essential.

Thank you, President Trump, for this order! https://t.co/iVlORcH5ZT

Congress passed some good bills this week - including the bipartisan WRDA - as well as partisan funding bills that will go nowhere in the Senate. Negotiations on COVID-19 relief funding have also stalled, so we are just waiting to see what develops.

More in my weekly update: https://t.co/r5iEgMDPGn
RT @KSLA: #TESTING: Eligible Veterans in the #Texarkana area can get tested for free starting on Saturday, Aug. 1. https://t.co/YoXUx2aX1o

Today, @TysonFoods announced increased testing to ensure the safety of their employees. Testing like this is absolutely necessary for essential workers. 

Thank you to all those who continue to keep our supply chain and infrastructure running smoothly! https://t.co/cA1ObutWXL

#ArkansasStrong! I'm glad to hear of Ms. Rheba's incredible recovery, thanks to our amazing doctors, nurses and other health care workers.

https://t.co/E2bOJF5eEL

Don't forget that taxes are due tomorrow, July 15. The IRS extended the deadline from April 15 to accommodate those affected by COVID-19. 

For FAQs and more information, visit the IRS site below.
https://t.co/LoD1Kg4upc
RT @RepFrenchHill: #Arkansas hospitals have had their internal testing capacity limited due to a shortage of reagents. Today, Sen. @JohnBoo…

Today is #ChronicDiseaseDay, which highlights the ever-present need for innovation in our health care system. Bills like the Promising Pathways Act and the Fair Care Act are necessary to make sure those with chronic illnesses get the best possible care.

https://t.co/0VdQYCjnCK

We have an opportunity to make health care affordable and accessible to every person. Tinkering with the status quo won't accomplish that goal. 

Instead, bills like the Fair Care Act pull ideas from both parties to make our health care system work better for all Americans. https://t.co/W6UkdBHb22

Even when we return to normal after COVID-19, I believe we should take many of the emergency medical procedures and use them to better our rural health care system across America.

My latest for @ArkansasOnline: https://t.co/fw5P4QsfjV

Arkansas Blood Institute is hosting pop-up locations across the state where you can safely donate blood or platelets. All donors will also receive a free COVID-19 antibody test.

If you are healthy and able, I encourage you to make an appointment, roll up a sleeve and give back! https://t.co/6fPc20RiQR

Great to see people headed back to work as states ease COVID-19 regulations. We still need to take precautions like wearing masks and social distancing, but we can slowly begin adjusting to a new normal.

Now we just need to get Congress back to work too!
https://t.co/1OVlmzisgA
RT @JohnBoozman: I welcome @HHSGov awarding another $2.5 million in federal coronavirus response funds to expand COVID-19 testing capacity…

On my way home from the airport, I stopped in Hot Springs Village for a COVID-19 test from @HCIArkansas. This free test is available to any Arkansan - you don’t have to leave your car and get results in 72 hours.

Visit https://t.co/pGqYepvj7B to see when they'll be in your area! https://t.co/AbNlp1amhe

If you've been exposed to COVID-19 and/or are experiencing symptoms, you should be tested immediately and impose a self-quarantine for 14 days, even if the test comes back negative.

A full list of testing sites in Arkansas: https://t.co/GjLEzgQrgM

@ArkansasDWS just launched a Pandemic Unemployment Assistance website, where anyone who doesn't typically qualify for unemployment benefits can apply. 

All PUA payments will be backdated to when an individual lost their job because of COVID-19. https://t.co/7ARkkgO3s7

Wishing all our educators a happy #NationalTeachersDay! Even a global pandemic hasn't stopped you from quickly adapting to the circumstances and continuing to teach students across the country.

We are grateful for all you do, today and every day. https://t.co/Km0TG38yrx

Tomorrow and Wednesday ONLY, @ArkansasEDC is opening applications for a new "Ready for Business" grant program. This initiative is targeted to small businesses needing additional funding in order to be COVID-19 compliant upon reopening.

More information: https://t.co/9C0B99ZZbn

Thanks to truck drivers and our supply chain personnel, we can still go to the grocery store and find stocked shelves, even during a global pandemic. Hopefully these masks give them an extra measure of safety as they transport goods across the country.

https://t.co/UV34LDpaWc

This morning, the SBA reopened Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) applications from approved lenders on behalf of eligible borrowers.

Why is this program important for Arkansas businesses? Allan Nichols, CEO of Mainline Health Systems in southeast AR, shares his perspective. https://t.co/OxrScJViZN

“Arbor Day is an opportunity to acknowledge the role our Nation’s forests and woodlands play in supporting our economy, health, and environment...we celebrate the contributions trees make to our way of life.” 

Thank you @POTUS for your support of forests!

Right now, the House is voting on whether to establish a subcommittee on COVID-19. However, we already have 8 oversight processes to track relief efforts.

This is an unnecessary and partisan waste of resources.

I'm back in D.C. to vote on the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act. Before PPP funding ran out, it had already assisted almost 22,000 businesses in AR.

This bill will bring necessary assistance to Americans - I only wish we could've voted on it sooner. https://t.co/bKW7d6uG1w

There is no quick fix to eliminating the virus, but this bill goes a long way in fighting COVID-19.

Every American can support planting a tree. The Trillion Trees Act isn't the only climate solution, but it's the best way to begin bipartisan reform.

I'm ready to work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to make our forests healthier, stronger, and more resilient. https://t.co/XALeYtr9b1

Actually it would 

🌲 Use scientific forest management, which = healthier forests
🌱 Reclaim marginal ag land and aid private landowners
🚗 Capture 2/3 of all manmade carbon emissions since the Industrial Revolution

Planting trees is the most practical climate solution we have. https://t.co/stA0HRZKuT

I'm grateful for the administration's efforts to make health care patient-centered. The Fair Care Act, which I introduced early this year, furthers many of the same priorities. I hope to work with @realDonaldTrump to lower costs, increase transparency, and empower patients. https://t.co/GfyTtej9Wj

The PRICED Act would be critical in making prescription drugs more affordable, which is why I included its provisions in the Fair Care Act. I'm grateful to join Rep. Schakowsky's work on this issue - proof that health care solutions can and should be bipartisan! https://t.co/1scD8zNnsf

Our nation is burning. Forest health and community safety isn’t a wish list; it’s our congressional duty. Our communities and our forests need the scientifically- backed tools included in the Resilient Federal Forests Act to ensure their safety and prosperity.

The @GHSChamber is in town this week, and it’s been such a pleasure hosting them. We’ve talked about issues from harbors to health care, and their input is invaluable as I work to represent folks back home. https://t.co/VjGiCvsIto

This is fantastic news. No individual should face discrimination in health care because of their moral convictions against issues like abortion, sterilization, or assisted suicide. https://t.co/IoApfz0u8i

US health care is broken, but so-called Medicare for All isn't the answer. Government-run health care inevitably results in high taxes, poor quality, and no choices.

America deserves better bills, like the Fair Care Act - people need freedom to choose care that works for them.
